genetics

Class Evolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • genetics.Evolution

  • public class Evolution
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the evolution. It contains a number of chromosomes that evolve, generation by generation, to a specified goal. The two important parameters that determine the evolutionary process are the mutation rate and the crossover rate.
    Author:
    Jakob Dhondt

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(java.util.List<IChromosome> population)
        This is a constructor for the Evolution class. It takes a list of chromosomes as input.
        Parameters:
        population - A list of chromosomes that represents the population.

      • Evolution

        public Evolution(java.util.List<IChromosome> population,
                 double m_rate,
                 double cr_rate)
        This is a constructor for the Evolution class. It takes list of chromosomes, a value for the mutation rate and a value for the crossover rate as input.
        Parameters:
        population - A list of chromosomes that represents the population.
        m_rate - The mutation rate.
        cr_rate - The crossover rate.

    • Method Detail

      • getNr_generations

        public int getNr_generations()
        This method returns the current number of generations.
        Returns:
        The number of generations.

      • setMUTATION_RATE

        public void setMUTATION_RATE(double mUTATION_RATE)
        This method sets the mutation rate.
        Parameters:
        mUTATION_RATE - The desired mutation rate.

      • setCROSSOVER_RATE

        public void setCROSSOVER_RATE(double cROSSOVER_RATE)
        This method sets the crossover rate.
        Parameters:
        cROSSOVER_RATE - The desired crossover rate.

      • evolve

        public void evolve()
        This is the central method of the Evolution class. It starts the evolutionary process and only ends if at least one chromosome has achieved the desired goal.

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        This method lets the gene pool evolve one generation. It executes all the necessary steps: selection, crossover and mutation.

      • evolveRandomly

        public void evolveRandomly()
        This method lets the pool of chromosomes 'evolve' randomly, i.e. without the selection or the crossover, just random mutation.

      • getFittest

        public IChromosome getFittest()
        This method returns the fittest chromosome of the current population.
        Returns:
        The fittest chromosome of the current population.

      • getPopulation

        public java.util.List<IChromosome> getPopulation()
        This method returns the current population.
        Returns:
        The current population.

      • resetPopulation

        public void resetPopulation()
        This method resets the current population to the initial population.
